titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Samuel Joseph Papers TAM.556
titlestmt.author: Collection processed by Peter Filardo

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

address.addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2023-06-13T14:00:55

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.abstract: Samuel Joseph (1858-1913) was a German American immigrant and apparently a member of the Socialist Labor Party. The collection contains several letters to Joseph, including one from Daniel De Leon, several unpublished manuscripts, including an untitled ms. about the Paris Exhibition of 1900 and the socialist movement in Europe, clippings, and biographical information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 2010.080.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Samuel Joseph (1858-1913) was a German American immigrant and apparently a member of the Socialist Labor Party.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Samuel Joesph Papers; TAM 556; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains several letters to Joseph, including one from Daniel De Leon, several unpublished manuscripts, including "The Discovery of Neptune, and an untitled ms. about the Paris Exhibition of 1900 and the socialist movement in Europe (principally in France and Germany), clippings, and biographical information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1895-1900, are expected to enter the public domain in 2020.

did.unittitle: Connecticut Labor Herald: Envelope with Clippings Sent to Samual Joseph in Handsboro, Mississippi [fragile]
De Leon, Daniel: Letter to Samuel Joseph
The Discovery of Neptune [Kollmorgen Vorwarts; ms., pp. 1-4, 6]
Milliken, Jno. B. [Connecticut Building and Loan Association]: Letter to Samuel Joseph re the latter's Studies of the Work of Karl Marx
Unitled ms. of the Paris Exhibition of 1900 and the Socialist Movement in Europe [chapter length]
